Reviews.Title: “Classic Madrileno Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTraveller61
Reviews.Content: A warm and inviting, small hotel with exceptional service and elegant guest rooms. Helpful and polite staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable. The small bar was well stocked and offered delicious tapas and complementary accompaniments. Can't wait to return for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: LondoJim
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this beautiful small hotel. Staff were warm and very helpful. Rooms were excellent -- large and well-equipped. Bar was thoroughly enjoyed. Can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base to do it all in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Pillarofhercules
Reviews.Content: We looked long and hard before selecting a hotel in madrid for our stay, and spoke to family of my wife (who are actually based there). They didn't know the hotel particularly well, but knew the location and strongly recommended it. Madrid is a relatively sprawling city, but with a relatively small 'mico centre.' This has got to be the best place to base yourself in the City, with access very easy (walking) access to main shopping areas, offbeat shopping areas and nightlight as well as the retiro etc. It is genuinely a superb base for a city break as it put you bang in the part of the city you want to be. The hotel itself is beautiful. Classic, but homely enough to still feel very boutique. You will find that alot of the 'classic' hotels in Madrid are on main road strips (say, the intercontinental) which are fine if you want to taxi everywhere but not if you don't. I found all of the staff here to be helpful and immediately wiling to assist which was great. I really enjoyed the hotel, and would definitely highly recommend it in madrid. For me personally, there are a few hotels in the top ten (for madrid) that I find amazing, but that's a personal opinion. If there was one criticism I had it would be that at breakfast the staff were clearly overwhelmed every day. saying that,when I decided I didn't want to wait for a table one morning the staff were very helpful is recommending a great place (literally across the street on the corner) which was excellent and is worth visiting in itself (think, walking back 50 years in time for some great coffee and churros). Anyway,I will be returning to this hotel on my next trip up to Madrid so am happy to recommend that anyone reading this does too.

Reviews.Title: “When they say 5-stars they actually mean every one of those stars”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTripper
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Adler while in Madrid was one that enhanced the overall pleasure of our vacation there. Adler's a wonderfully appointed hotel retaining an old world charm. The attention lavished by the staff was genuine and made us feel comfortable since the moment we walked in the door. While not exactly in the 'heart of the tourist area', we couldn't have asked for a more convenient location. Situated beside 2 metro lines (less than 5 min walk to either of them) ... and yet quite walk-able to every one of the prominent sites; the restaurant, cafés, bars and shopping near Adler make it a very convenient location. In truth, we'd rather stay in this location (than those that turn up in the heart of the 'tourist' area) away from the usual din of tourists and tourist-trap restaurants and souvenir stores - allowing us to unwind from our days spent exploring Madrid. The rooms were spacious and well appointed; the staff were attentive and friendly and made us feel right at 'home'. This is definitely going to be the hotel of choice for our trips back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 star boutique hotel with extraordinarily friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: California77
Reviews.Content: The Adler is a terrific value for a 5 star hotel. Beautifully appointed and with a staff which defines friendliness. My wife and I stayed at the Adler for ten days while visiting our daughter in Madrid and we could not have been more pleased with our selection. We have traveled all over the world and have never experienced a more friendly or accommodating staff, from the doorman to the manger. The room was well appointed and despite it's facing the street, nighttime noise was minimal. We did not visit the restaurant in the hotel or use room service as we wanted to experience the many good restaurants of Madrid. All in all a great choice for a very reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eddie B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Adler a couple of times now when in Madrid visiting friends. It's such a beautiful hotel. It's grand without being too big. The rooms are large, very luxurious and decadently decorated. The hotel itself is very conveniently situated for high end shopping and eating and there's the added benefit of the hotel garage to store your car if you have one. I found it to be quite appropriately priced at around 300 eur a night for the quality you get. I will definitely be going back in future.

Reviews.Title: “WORTH it!”
Reviews.Author: P1965P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our aniversary and it was well worth it. We loved the room, service and staff. I would have loved to have stayed here for a month. Excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Highly recommended for all!”
Reviews.Author: suven
Reviews.Content: I requested a quiet room in advance. I was given room 310 and loved it. The staff members are all exceptionally friendly and helpful. They gave us great recommendations for restaurants and were very helpful with our sight seeing questions. They were always willing to hail us a cab (we often used the metro which is very very close to the hotel). We walked from El Prado to the hotel a few times by choice. That walk was approminately 20 minutes, but we also kept stopping to look around and take pictures of everything. Cabs are very easy to get near the hotel. There is never a shortage. Our room was cleaned twice per day and we were always satisfied with the quality of cleaning. The hotel has free wi-fi, but we did have trouble connecting now and then. Regardless, we got access to everything we needed! The hotel restaurant is also very good. I highly recommend Adler Hotel to all and I hope to be able to visit again! My only suggestions (which are separate and apart from the hotel, but probably apply for any international tourists visiting Madrid): If you don't need to check luggage on your flight to Madrid, don't do it. Barajas airport is very bad with luggage. They disregard "priority" tags. My husband and I waited- along with a crew member from our flight- for over an hour for our luggage to come out. When we asked about this, we were told it's completely normal to wait an hour or more to retrieve luggage from Barajas. And, they don't do overhead announcements at Barajas to let you know what's going on. Even airline crew members are subjected to this. Also, don't take a taxi from the airport unless you really need to. Taxis line up in front of the airport, so you have to take the cab that's first in line. Be very careful about getting a receipt and writing down all of the information about the cab (license plate number and cab number- which is inside the cab). In fact, tell the driver up front that you will be requesting a receipt upon your arrival. Maybe that will discourage a driver from taking you on a gypsy ride. You'll need a receipt later if you want to file a claim against the driver. A taxi should not cost any more than 30 Euros to get from Barajas into the city center. We ended up with a driver who restarted the meter during our trip and charged us 65 Euros. My husband speaks fluent Spanish and I had maps in my hand and was telling the driver exactly where we wanted to go. None of this discouraged him from ripping us off and proudly announcing "there is too much traffic that way". I later learned that the ride should have cost no more than 20 Euros at that time of day. And, to file a complaint, I would have needed a receipt from the driver. An Adler employee hailed a cab for us to get back to the airport for our departure. We arrived in about 20 minutes and paid 18 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL GREAT LOCATİON”
Reviews.Author: travel_wisconsinmi
Reviews.Content: had a fantastic stay at the Adler Hotel. the rooms are wonderfully modern and classy yet very cozy. the staff is awesome.thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but not for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Lee1224
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located in the upscale shopping area of Madrid..Attentive Staff, Very Nice Rooms with all amenities..This hotel is attractive to Business People..we were the only tourists staying at hotel..location of hotel is far from tourist attractions..Great Hotel but would not recommend for first time touring of Madrid..

Reviews.Title: “Intimate, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingerhshy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adler for four nights in early November while on a business trip. First, the staff is top-notch, from the bellmen and reception staff, to the housekeeping team. Everyone bent over backwards to help us with every little request. Second, the lobby and small bar area are beautifully appointed and very comfortable. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but it looked lovely from what we could see. Our room overlooked the street on the second floor, but we had no problems with street noise. The room was decent size, with a good-sized bathroom. I adored the chocolates with the turn down service at night, and the manager sent up a fruit basket, which was really nice to have around. The WiFi was sporadic in our room, but it was actually nice to sit in the lobby from time to time and enjoy a coffee or wine, while downloading email The location was good for our business, but also in a nice neighborhood with shops and restaurants. We walked down to Retiro Park and on to the Prado one afternoon; there is also a nearby metro station that will get you around to the other sights. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a little pampering and doesn't need all of the amenities of a larger hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hic....verrrrry verrrrrrry nice hotelllll......hic.....”
Reviews.Author: psyap
Reviews.Content: Friday 21 January 2011 Arrived in Madrid...Yay! tapas country! Must have visited all the tapas bars from the metro to the hotel - fantastic food and the wine...hic...verrrrrry verrrrry nice...hic...Got to the hotel finally and checked in - somehow was expecting White Rabbit to run down the stairs saying he's late, he's late...may have something to do with the amount of alcohol consumed or the decor of the reception or both... Room very roomy and bed very comfortable...loved the bathroom - lots of space to put all my lotions and potions (god knows I need all the help I can get!) - could have stayed all day in the bathroom! Didn't manage to eat one single meal at the hotel as there were so many great restaurants nearby...fab location for hotel!...and the shopping - that's another story altogether! Went off to Mercado San Miguel to eat and drink some more, then carried on drinking in Plaza Mayor... Definitely would come back. Staff friendly and very helpful, liked the memorable eclectic decor of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Adler Hotel”
Reviews.Author: taylaiwat
Reviews.Content: One of the best boutique hotel with impeccable service. Stayed in room 101, the best bathroom facilities ever. Breakfast was delicious, and service excellent. Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay -- will return”
Reviews.Author: GuruAsia
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice at the Adler in September. I can only comment on the room and the reception service since I took all my meals outside. The rooms I stayed in were well appointed. A little dark maybe but this is downtown Madrid in a historical building so this is as good as it will get. Both were street facing but quiet even though they were overlooking the busy Velasquez - Goya intersection. Comfortable bed, good amenities, the bathroom is not very large but perfectly sufficient with a bathtub / shower. The hotel has a free wifi service in addition to the chargeable internet broadband connection in the rooms. It was down the first time but working well the second time. The reception service was excellent. Arriving mid-morning from Asia, I was able to have an early check-in. Staff was very pleasant, extremely helpful, and professional. I left with an excellent overall impression and I can recommend the hotel wholeheartedly both for business travelers as well as tourists. I will visit Madrid regularly and will return to the Adler.

Reviews.Title: “if you want it quiet ... expect no views”
Reviews.Author: NYC-piano
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel that is well appointed and nicely located, but the room we were given had absolutely no view. The windows of our room looked onto the interior well (can't really call such a diminutive space a courtyard proper). The room was spacious but the bed was small for 2, and the light definitely a problem, perhaps due to the windows' situation; the other Hotel windows visible from the street seemed substantially larger/taller than ours, some almost floor to ceiling. On the plus side, the room was indeed very quiet as promised at check-in (there was construction on the sidewalk which exarcebated the traffic noise). Also on the plus side: the hotel staff was very courteous and arranged for a very early check-in for us, at no extra charge. Perhaps we should have asked to change room right away - trading off some noise for better light and at least some view. I do not believe that the room we stayed in should be rated more than a 3* because of that, and I am not sure a Hotel of this stature should even offer such rooms to its clients; it was only because of the overall charm of the Hotel that I rated our overall experience at the Adler a 4 stars (just barely).

Reviews.Title: “Well located beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrimesWeaver
Reviews.Content: Adler will be my choice moving forward when I stay in Madrid again. There are other beautiful luxury hotels in Madrid, but they are larger and more impersonal despite their luxury. I choose personalized customer service over glamour anytime, and Adler fits the bill. The accommodations and decor are nothing short of top notch. The hotel and rooms are very well appointed and immaculate. The staff offer some of the best hospitality I have come across and were extraordiarily helpful during a recent long weekend in Madrid. The front desk staff not only performed perfunctory customer service with grace, but their personal touch to offering assitance and guidance was much appreciated. All major Madrid sights are close by and very walkable, though the metro and taxis are easily accessed as well. The neighborhood is wonderful and a bit off the tourist trail. Morning runs at the Retiro park were just a quick jog down the street and there were ample local eating establishments. The room we stayed in was large, stylish and extraordinary. The bathroom was lovely and well appointed. The room itself was quiet and bright. WiFi was fine for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: DoctorLily
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the great reviews shown here and the 5 star rating. I was disappointed upon arrival because the hotel felt more like a 3 star. It was nice and all but not the luxury experience I was anticipating so I stayed one night then checked out and went to Hotel Ritz. The rooms are large, the staff very helpful, and the hotel is spotless. I enjoyed the location because it offered a break from all the tourists. I went out walking during dinner time in the neighboorhood and saw mostly locals out - couples, families, groups of young people. It was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Could use a Few Changes”
Reviews.Author: gwillen100
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with a friendly staff. In a nice quiet location in Madrid, near the Metro line. However, to get a better rating they need to work on the following: - Need a better Wi-Fi system; the current one is very slow - The TV location was at an odd angle to the bed; also most of the hotels of this class have wall mounted flat screens with a larger picture - There was no small computer/printer office set up that could be used for updating airline E-tickets and other things; especially since the wireless was slow; Other lower class hotels that we stayed at in Spain had these set-ups; Adler had to set up a temporary laptop when needed

Reviews.Title: “charming and spotless”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: Charming building. Charming staff. Absolutely spotless rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful top-class boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JNWSuisse
Reviews.Content: The hotel Adler is a gem. Situated in the chic barrios Salamanca in Madrid surrounded by beautiful shops, wide avenues and the Parque del Retiro. This is a small five star hotel with large elegant bedrooms, friendly, helpful and well trained staff in a great location. There is underground parking. An easy walk to the Prado but you need a taxi to get to the old part of town and the Plaza Mayor. We stayed here twice and would always stay here in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel during my visit to the Iberia”
Reviews.Author: jim s
Reviews.Content: Two week between portugal and spain, 8 different hotels, all 5 star, and this has the best. good location, great rooms and service. big recomendation

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: BazerSpain
Reviews.Content: This is a small and beautiful hotel in the middle of the city. The room was one of the nicest I have ever stayed in with very comfortable beds, affording a superb nights sleep. The only down side is that the bathroom was a little dated and not quite up to 5 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: StephHitH
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel in a lovely part of Madrid and within walking distance of the main attractions (even if you don't want to walk the metro is very close and taxis are readily available). The hotel is well run with friendly, knowledgeable staff who have great English (which given my lack of Spanish was fabulous). They made recommendations for dinner, including a flamenco display that were great. The restaurant in the hotel itself was excellent and worth a visit. I do think it is expensive for breakfast but there are a couple of cafes nearby that are much more reasonable and very enjoyable. We will come back here when we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertbaldock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum for a couple of nights in August. It's in a great location, very close to the Retiro and only a fifteen minute walk from the Prado. The Hotel itself is beautiful, quiet and understated. The staff is exceptionally good: charming, helpful and attentive. The room we stayed in was very good value for money, very clean and very comfortable. An excellent hotel in a fantastic city; the positive reviews the Adler has received on this website are completely deserved.

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible Luxury Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: achinca
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two night with my wife in July 2011 and we were so sad to leave the Adtler Hotel. Our stay was truly a magic experience. First the location: It is in the wealthy area of Madrid (away from the Old City) with incredible shopping and eating. If you do not feel like walking, the excellent Madrid subway is 30 seconds from the hotel. The hotel itself is a fantastic boutique hotel. It is a limited number of rooms which allows them to focus extansively on their guests. The room was beautiful and luxurious and the bathroom blew my mind. The attention to detail is beyond imaginable. The staff is truly outstanding. They go out of their way to help you and make your stay as comfortable as they can. They are very friendly, knowledgable and caring. The cost is not cheap but you getting the level of service you are paying for. It put to shame the so-called American luxury-chains. This is high class luxury and I promised my wife we will stay there again next time we are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Fab4famiy
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for four nights and we loved it. The English speaking concierge and staff were wonderful. The location is in a great part of Madrid. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Adler again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: X11725
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Adler Hotel for 3 nights in early May. Wondful location - 50 steps from the great Metro and within 800 metres of the Prado Museum. Warm welcome on arrival - lovely staff - very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MarySacramento
Reviews.Content: My brother and sister in law met another sister and myself for 3 nights at the Hotel Adler. We loved our rooms. My brother's was quieter on the 4th floor without a balcony. Ours was on the first floor with a small balcony perfect for people watching. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a great location for walking all over the city. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Contacting Hotel Adler”
Reviews.Author: winnie3020
Reviews.Content: I have tried to contact the Hotel Adler in regards to a future reservation modification on two seperate requests. As I write this review I have still have not received a reply, this concerns me. I gave the establishment the benefit of doubt that perhaps their internet was down or perhaps my request needed to be interperted. I now know, this is not the case, after reading their responses to the last three reviews. I am now concerned about staying in a hotel that does not follow up with its prospective guests.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, but expensive drinks & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rod_langham
Reviews.Content: I agree with most other reviewers of this hotel - it is superb, esp. the service of the staff and attention to detail. However, ensure you get a room on floors 3 or 4 - this hotel is on a busy intersection, and traffic screams away from the lights. Could be very noisy in summer - don't open the windows! Drinks were v. expensive, and we paid for 2 persons breakfast at the coffe & tea bar opposite what the hotel wanted for a coffee & croissant. Do try LateraL tapas bar along the street at 25 Velasquez for Tapas - but get there before 8pm 'cos it gets very busy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and delightful room”
Reviews.Author: siobhanmuskett
Reviews.Content: We spent two very pleasant nights at this lovely hotel. The decor was elegant, quality fabrics, stylish lighting, well equipped and spacious(it is a city hotel) room and bathroom. Very quiet, we slept well in the comfortable bed. The welcome and service was outstanding. Our room was tidied up in the evening including clean towels. Free fruit was a nice touch. The location was stylish, nice shops and restaurants, a bit of a walk to the old town but near the museums and park. The palace was closed, suggest you check if it is an important for you to visit. Definitely recommend a short break in Madrid, especially during the sales. We would stay at the Adler again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay EVER.”
Reviews.Author: AliciafromTexas
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The beds are great. The rooms are huge with high ceilings. The staff is LOVELY, attentive, and quick. The location is a bit far from the center of the city but only a 10 minute taxi ride. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “So happy!”
Reviews.Author: jsmithwilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Adler for three wonderful nights on our second visit to Madrid. The hotel is a small, stylish and quiet. A high level of service and attention. Spacious and comfortable rooms and lovely bathrooms. The breakfast is delicious and room service is very good. After staying close to the Prado on a previous trip, we all agreed that the Hotel Adler was much better. The neighborhood is filled with great galleries, restaurants and shopping. We walked to the Prado and Reina Sofia museums, And, explored the neighborhood of the hotel. Our room was very clean, the bed very comfortable. We ordered room service one night and it was delicious. This hotel takes great pride in the quality of service and attention it gives its guests. I would stay here for a romantic weekend with my husband or a trip to Madrid with my sisters or my mother. This time I was travelling with two teenagers and it was fine for them.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate”
Reviews.Author: Shi Hu
Reviews.Content: Well, other travelers have pretty much said it all. This is a first rate, refined, boutique hotel with a superb staff. Our adequately sized room #394 was located in the front of the hotel but it was very quiet, the beds and bedding comfortable. The bathroom, closets and drawer space were large enough for our 5 night stay. We were happy to have the wifi availability at no extra charge and a lovely basket of beautiful fruit was delivered to our room. The restaurant was fine though not outstanding. The staff throughout - reception, housekeeping and restaurant - was amongst the very best we've ever experienced and we greatly appreciated the professional, helpful and non-intrusive demeanor of every staff member. Why not a 5 rating? I have had more superb and spacious accommodations. Think a bungalow at the Auberge de Sole. Though, this room suited our needs in Madrid. When traveling, even though I may have been satisfied with a particular hotel, I would usually like to try a different hotel when returning to a city. When returning to Madrid, I would definitely stay at the Adler again and HIGHLY recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Edgemont2
Reviews.Content: Three nights in Madrid in late September 2010 were very well spent in the Hotel Adler. Located in the Salamanca district, an upscale area, it is close to excellent shopping and has a Metro stop just across the avenue. It is a brisk 15 minute walk from the hotel to the Prado. The hotel itself is a recently converted 19th century building with 21st century amenities. The rooms are of decent size and are attractively decorated. Despite being on a busy street, noise is not an issue. The staff is discrete and very helpful. The free Wi-Fi in the room worked well. The bathroom is handsomely appointed with only the "usual" awkward European shower to criticize. The hotel breakfast is far too expensive but there are a number of nearby restaurants with more modestly priced alternatives. An excellent choice for a Madrid visit.

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury without pretension”
Reviews.Author: rachilde
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, comfortable and quiet. The staff were pleasant and professional. the lobby was a great place to meet friends and enjoy a glass of wine. It's on the quiet side rather than bustling and that was just fine with us. 20 minute walk to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mali
Reviews.Content: O.K. It´s not a cheap hotel, but its worth every Euro. I want to go back to Madrid just to stay in this hotel. The hotel is very good located (near the chic boutiques, restaurants and night clubs), the service is excellent!!, and the beds...perfect! I also like that is not your typical ¨big, touristy, chain hotel¨, but small, luxurious and low key. Everything was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: westonct1998
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Adler during a recent buisness trip to Madrd. Located in the Salamanca neighborhoo, which is full of excellent Spanish restaurants, Only issue would be the absurdly expensive breakfast at Euros 27 per person - way too excessive and certainly not worth that much. Room was rather on the small side but well appointed. Location and service may the difference.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful experience in every respect”
Reviews.Author: homme-de-nuit
Reviews.Content: Extraordinarily friendly and competent service, ideal location, tastefully decorated and quiet rooms, and excellent value for money compared to other major European capitals. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in THE best area of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirewife
Reviews.Content: The Adler Hotel is in the Salamanca district of Madrid which is the poshest area of the city. The staff were absolutely charming and ahead of every request. Our room was superb, clean bedding daily, fresh fruit and turn down service with chocolates done after our departure for dinner. Genteel, well mannered staff were just outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, safe, attentive, close to museums, shopping and metro”
Reviews.Author: Jsusse
Reviews.Content: The staff at this wonderful, little hotel took very good care of my needs without being intrusive. As a single woman travelling alone, I felt very welcomed and valued. The staff was very helpful and attentive to my needs. It was slightly pricey, but well worth it for the peace of mind and quiet comfort that it offered. My interest was visiting the museums and experiencing the boutique shopping that the area had to offer and I was not disappointed. The room was restful and well appointed. The breakfast experience was delightful. I cannot say enough about how kind the staff was to me. I would return if I had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: superubi
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time before i succeded to find this hotel as all other hotels were booked completely. But in the end i'm really satisfied with my choise. Hotel is situated not exactly in the center but really close to it. Maybe is better so, because you can avoid all the crowds of tourists, traffic..etc...The zone is really nice, peaceful, with a lot of shops, cafes and restaurants, and the most important thing (at least for me) that is not a touristic zone. You get to the center just 10 min walking or by taking a metro (hotel station is Velasquez or Serrano)... Inside hotel is very clean, good organized... The stuff was really friendly and helped us in everything... The thing that i liked most is the size of the room - it was spacious, i didn't have any problem to move and i didn't feel myself like a mouse in a trap...The room is furnished in an old style, but with new furniture and that looks great! By our arrival there was prepared a welcome dish with different fruits...so it served also as lunch in the morning... Room was cleaned i think even twice per day, every time with changing of the towels. Also the room was equiped good, there was everything that you can need for a pleasant staying: tv with sattelite, slippers, bath set, bathrobe, umbrella...etc... The only minus is that we stayed there only 2 days..

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Steph2727
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in early December. We got a great rate through World Hotels. The Adler has a wonderful location right in the middle of the Salamanca area. Room was very spacious and the beds were very comfortable. Management sent a fruit basket with the largest juiciest orange I have ever seen! As I had a cold this was greatly appreciated. The decor of the hotel was very stylish. There was no outside noise and were able to get a very good nights rest. We did not eat in the restaurant as we wanted to dine before it was open. Would definitely stay at The Adler again when visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HuntNC
Reviews.Content: While the location of this hotel is not very good for tourist, it is located near Metro and has excellent access to taxis. The hotel is quite lovely and one of the nicest rooms decors we had on our trip. Very elegant as was the neighborhood. The bar was cozy and we loved it but the service was very spotty. The few times we had a good server it was truly excellent. The concierge service seemed to be very limited and we did not like the resturants they sent us to. We learned to find our own spots in the neighborhood which were great! Staff spoke limited english so we were lucky to have a travel companion that was fluent in Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location could be better”
Reviews.Author: Rover10
Reviews.Content: Well staffed boutique hotel. Rooms pleasant and quiet - we were located at the rear of the hotel with a great view of a blank wall but the quiet suited us. Breakfast good with excellent service. However, this hotel is located a good 30-40 minutes walk (or 10 minutes by taxi) from Madrid's main attractions - Plaza Mayor, Royal Palace, etc. 15 minutes from Prado (hotel blurb says " a stones throw" - maybe if you're an Olympic javelin thrower.) If you don't mind that it's a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LRaykoff
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. The lobby, the staff, the rooms, the locations, etc., I cannot say enough positve things about it. The rooms were beautifully decorated, elegant, warm and inviting. The staff was attentive, helpful and all in all our stay was terrific. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home (Mi hogar fuera de mi hogar)”
Reviews.Author: LSCaribbean
Reviews.Content: This is a small centrally located hotel located in exclusive Barrio de Salamanca. The staff is very helpful and take a personal interest in providing all the information and help you may need. The rooms are impeccably maintained, including a fruit basket, and catering to all your requests. No coffee in room but room service is very quick. The service is perfect, they keep a record of your requests and preferences. My room was the same one I had during a previous stay. Taxis are easily available day and night except at rush hour (8-10PM). Get some advice on what to do if you do not find a taxi. Keep some taxi service telephone numbers at hand. Limo service is very good with well mannered informed drivers. The lovely restaurant offers excellent service and food with a good wine list. Rooms have all the toiletries you may need. Laundry service is perfect. WiFi available most of the time depending on the telephone company delivering the prepaid cards on time. You may walk safely outside at night, there are numerous cafes, tabernas, and restaurants that begin to fill up after 9PM. Madrid is a beautiful, lively city. This lovely hotel is the best kept secret! (El pequeno hotel es excelente en todos los aspectos, lo recomiendo totalmente. El servicio personalizado es excepcional y esta localizado en la centrica zona del Barrio de Salamanca donde podemos caminar a tiendas, cafes, restaurantes, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “A GEM OF A HOTEL IN MADRID!!!”
Reviews.Author: elmarko
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Absolutely fantastic. Right in the Salamanca district near fine shops and restaurants. Also convenient to two Metro stations within 2 blocks each way. Simply one of the finest hotels we've ever stayed at in Europe! Spent 5 wonderful days in Madrid, and the service, professionalism, and attention at the Adler could not have been better. The staff is superior with one of the warmest, friendlest attitudes of any place we've ever visited in the WORLD! Save the $$$ you would spend for a room at the Ritz and stay here. The rooms are extraordinarily large for Europe with double sinks in the marble bathroom, plus ALL ROOMS ARE SOUNDPROOFED SO YOU DON'T HEAR A PEEP! The restaurant in the hotel was a little pricey, but that was completely insignificant. I can assure you that if you stay at the Adler you'll come away saying the same wonderful things I've experienced. There really wasn't anything to criticize. This place is a real find!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After I had already decided on staying at the Hotel Adler, I read some of the disappointing reviews and was a little hesitant about staying at the hotel. However, I found all of the negative comments to be 100% false. The hotel was extremely clean and beautiful. The staff was courteous and helpful in all situations. I arrived earlier than I expected. However, the room I requested (one on a high floor) was provided without any wait. When I returned in the afternoon, a large fresh fruit place (along with a message from the manager) was in the room. My room faced the busy street, but with the windows and shutters closed, I did not hear a thing at night. During my entire four night stay, I did not encounter one problem. The hotel is small (only 48 rooms) and if you are looking for an active lobby bar, this is not the place. However, the room was large (queen bed with a large desk, small table and two chairs for a sitting area), and sunny with the windows open. The bathroom was large (altough the counter space was minimal). The hotel is also very convenient to wonderful shopping. I booked directly through their website and found that to be the best price. I highly recommend this hotel for a relaxing, comfortable stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Well below five star standard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very expensive and has many positive reviews on Tripadvisor and elsewhere. Therefore I had high expectations for my two night visit...Oh what a let down! On the positive side, the room had quality furniture and a warm and charming design style. It was modern without being cold and minimalist. The bathroom was also excellent..well almost...and the staff were friendly and helpful. HOWEVER...This hotel does not deserve five stars and falls well short of the standards required of a property at that level. The problems started when we called room service for a snack at 7pm and were told that the kitchen only opens at 8pm! This was incorrect and there was a minimal service available 24hrs, but the restaurant, where the room service calls are received, was apparently unaware of this...very odd! On another occasion we ordered dinner with wine, which arrived with no wine glasses. This situation continued with items missing from the breakfast order and a yogurt with mould growing on it. It did get so bad I was expecting John Cleese to deliver the next room service order! So other than the room service, what else was wrong?...Our room had no balcony and had a view of the walls surrounding the entrance to the car park. It was very dark with almost no natural light. I asked to change, but was informed that the only other options would either be smaller or would only have twin beds....so we stayed in the gloom! Other issues were the lobby and bar, which were sterile and totally lacking in atmosphere...They remained empty for my entire stay. There was also the shower, which was designed in such a way that it leaked water all over the bathroom floor...I could go on, but the summary is that this is NOT a hotel worthy of five stars or the prices it charges. I would not go back and would strongly recommend that others avoid this place. There are many better options in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “5 star rating and still not a sanitized bathroom”
Reviews.Author: anon2990
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the last leg of my trip after traveling for 3 weeks in Spain. After staying in some places that I thought couldn't even get a 1 star rating, I longed to a few days of relaxing in a five star hotel. First impression, yes, this is for the sophisticated, well heeled traveler or savvy business professional. I walked in in flip flops and a duffel bag and those around me were in Prada and Chanel. I couldn't wait to get to my room and soak in a bubble bath. I thought I had finally left all those other hotels where cleanliness was dubious at best. When I walked into my room it was indeed, very luxorious in every detail from the fine furnishings to the expensive fabrics on the bed and the curtains. Yippee, I thought!! Finally, a slice of heaven. I ripped off my clothes and headed straight for my bubble bath only to find in my 5 star hotel, two very unwanted pieces of hair which I will not describe further, but they clearly didn't come from me or the cleaning person's head. Yuck!! As an American, we have OSHA regulations and hygiene in most hotels is a given. In Spain, I found so many hotels fell short in cleanliness and this hotel, sadly, proved to follow suit. At $400+ a night, I EXPECTED a properly sanitized bathroom. I still took my bubble bath anyway, but my lasting impression of this hotel will always be a bad visual of p***** hair.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - be carefull with rooms with traffic noise.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, beatiful interior, friendly staff, wonderfull restaurant, placed in the middle of the wonderfull Salamanca area. However - be carefull with rooms facing the street if you are sensitive to noise. The hotel is facing the Velazquez and Goya streets which are full of traffic day and night. During my stay it was allmost impossible for me to sleep - my room was on 1st. floor.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: traveloften32655
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is awesome! It has a highly trained staff who was friendly and extremely attentive and we are tough critics! The rooms are beautifully appointed and very quiet, even facing the main street. The bathrooms are all marble with a totally seperate area for the toilet. There is plenty of closet and drawer space, and they gave us a wonderful fruit basket upon arrival. If you call internationally, do not dial direct from the Hotel, as it is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSPrima
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel. I stayed there last July during a heat-wave. But unlike most hotels in Europe during the summer, the heat was not a problem. The air-conditioning worked perfectly. Beautiful rooms. Comfortable beds, large living area, large bathrooms. I was there on business and was able to work in my room for hours without any problems (although, they did not have high-speed). The staff at the front desk was excellent. I had an emergency dental problem when I was there and they found me dentist that spoke English and was open on Saturday (amazing feat for the summer in Spain). The food in the restaurant was amazing. I loved dining there. The hotel is located in the heart of the shopping district and very close to the museums. The next time I'm in Madrid, I plan on staying there again.
